value.name: This Philly lawyer works to empty death row. His new book reveals an absurd, broken system.
value.description: From the very first death-penalty appeal he worked on, Marc Bookman came to understand how crucial writing can be in life-and-death matters. The verdict form was missing a single “s” — an error that changed the meaning of the verdict enough to overturn the sentence.
